alert.note: Alert for Northern Westchester; Orange; Putnam; Rockland (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 3:43PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Westchester, southeastern Orange, Putnam and Rockland Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 342 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near West Point, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Newburgh, Peekskill, Haverstraw, Mahopac, Monroe, Lake Carmel, West Point, Cold Spring, New Windsor, Greenwood Lake, Pomona, Harriman, Fahnestock State Park, Kiryas Joel and Stony Point. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
